text.p: Italian bonds ended down in the wake of a strong showing for French Socialists in the first round of elections but brokers said they were waiting for Tuesday to see the true market assessment.
With both London and U.S. players off on a three-day weekend, volumes were limited but the June Btp future on MIF fell 79 basis points to 129.15.

The February 2007 Btp was 70 basis points lower at 96.57 with the yield at 7.28 percent and the spread over 10-year Bund 135 basis points. The lira dipped early to near to its ERM central parity of 990 per mark before coming back to 986.30.
"The French elections have brought what is possibly an excessive fall in Btps which can be explained by the thin volume," one trader said.

At home, the market is hoping for titbits from a meeting of leaders of parties in the centre-left government this evening who will talk about the three-year economic plan (Dpef) before the document is unveiled at the end of the week.

Expectations for a fall in the 6.75 percent discount rate remain, with some seeing a cut by Friday evening before the Bank of Italy bank holds its annual meeting Saturday. Others expect the central bank to wait until next week.-Milan +392 66129507
